channel.title: TalkLeft: The Politics of Crime
channel.description: Liberal Coverage of Crime-Related Political and Injustice News

item.title: Thanksgiving Blogging of Years Past
item.subject: Blog Related
item.description: Last Thanksgiving, I had a cast on my wrist and reduced my blogging for the weekend. Little did I know then it would get progressively worse until March when I finally had sugery on it. Jay Allen, who is the...

item.title: Study: More Blacks Imprisoned Under Sentencing Guidelines
item.subject: Crime Policy
item.description: Analysis of the recently released 15 year study of federal sentencing guidelines in beginning to stream in. One major finding: Since the guidelines were enacted in 1987, the number of blacks imprisoned has increased sharply and they receive harsher sentences...

item.title: Holiday Blogging
item.subject: Blog Related
item.description: Holiday blogging will be light here, as the TL kid is going to be in town and I'm getting ready to move houses for the first time in 13 years. It doesn't mean non-existent, just light. TChris is away for...

item.title: Sandy Murphy and Rick Tabish Acquitted at Retrial of Binion Murder
item.subject: Crimes in the News
item.description: Great news for Sandy Murphy and Rick Tabish. They were acquitted of murdering Las Vegas casino son Benny Binion. At their last trial, they were both convicted. After deliberating for about 18 hours, the jury returned on Tuesday morning with...

item.title: High Court to Consider Medical Marijuana Case
item.subject: Court Decisions
item.description: The John Ashcroft legacy will include, in addition to the Patriot Act, the validity of medical marijuana raids. On Monday, the Supreme Court will hear arguments in Raich v. Ashcroft. Check out Drug War Rant, which has compiled an incredibly...

item.title: U.S. Sentencing Commission Issues 15 Year Summary Report
item.subject: Crime Policy
item.description: The U.S. Sentencing Commission has issued its long awaited 15 year summary report on federal sentencing. Law Prof Doug Berman at Sentencing Law and Policy has the details and the important highlights. Links to the actual reports are here....

item.title: Dan Rather Stepping Down
item.subject: Media
item.description: So Dan Rather is stepping down as nightly news anchor at CBS. The press release makes no mention of his Texas National Guard story. Why now? I don't think it's just the end of the election cycle as he says....

item.title: Site Update
item.subject: Blog Related
item.description: The trolls were out in force today. We'll be deleting most of their comments. Don't bother commenting under other names to get around the four comment a day rule, as we'll be going by IP address (seen only by us)...

item.title: Truth-In-Sentencing Laws Exposed
item.subject: Crime Policy
item.description: Wisconsin has one of the strictest "truth in sentencing laws" in the nation. The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel is running a series on them, exposing them for what they are: brutally unfair and extravagently expensive. They also remove incentives and cause...

item.title: Bush: What Mandate?
item.subject: Elections
item.description: Three million voters propelled Bush to victory over Kerry in November. Conservatives claimed this was a mandate for Bush and his policies. Not so. The newest CBS/New York Times poll shows Americans are non-supportive of his agenda: At a time...

item.title: Cameraman Kevin Sites Explains Outing Marine Killing
item.subject: War in Iraq
item.description: Last week, NBC cameraman Kevin Sites, embedded with the Marines in Fallujah, wrote a startling report of a marine who shot and killed an already wounded Iraqi insurgent. On his website, Sites explains why he did it, in an open...

item.title: Round the Bloggerhood
item.subject: Blog Related
item.description: Time to update your bookmarks....Avedon Carol of Sideshow has moved the blog to its new home. Here's the new link. Libertartian Robert Prather is back blogging, this time as part of the group blog Signifying Nothing. Say hello to Grits...

item.title: Texecution Alert: Frances Newton May Be Innocent
item.subject: Death Penalty
item.description: Nine days and counting down to the scheduled texecution of Frances Newton. She may be innocent. The National Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty writes: Frances Newton faces execution in Texas Dec. 1, despite resounding doubts about her guilt. Newton's...

item.title: Executing Charles Walker
item.subject: Death Penalty
item.description: by TChris Should Charles Walker die? Never in North Carolina, and perhaps not in the United States, has the state executed a convicted murderer when there is no body or even a trace of blood indicating a crime was committed....

item.title: Vilsack Withdraws Name From DNC Chair Consideration
item.subject: Politics - Other
item.description: Iowa Governor Tom Vilsack says "no thanks" to the DNC chairship and withdraws his name from consideration. Will it go to Howard Dean?...

item.title: Task Force 121 Abused Detainees and Government Knew It
item.subject: War in Iraq
item.description: The Washington Post has obtained a non-published report of an investigation by retired Col. Stewart Harrington. The upshot: Task Force 121 was abusing Iraqi detainees and the Government knew it early on. A confidential report to Army generals in Iraq...

item.title: Excessive Police Force Against Protesters to Cost Portland $300k
item.subject: Civil Liberties
item.description: The City of Portland, Oregon will pay out $300,000 in damages to protesters affected by excessive police force during anti-Bush and anti-war demonstrations last year: In the two lawsuits, the plaintiffs argued that the city, Mayor Vera Katz, then-police Chief...

item.title: Ebersol Family Releases Statement
item.subject: Off Topic
item.description: Update: NBC execs who visited Dick Ebersol in the hospital comment on his condition - and on Charlie's heroic rescue of his dad. ****************** The plane crash in Colorado Sunday that took the lives of three people, spared two and...

item.title: Scott Peterson Death Penalty Trial Begins
item.subject: Crimes in the News
item.description: Jurors are hearing evidence in the penalty phase of Scott Peterson's murder trial. The prosecution gave its opening argument, the defense has reserved the option to make one at the beginning of its case. Only four witnesses will testify for...

item.title: Court Rules Pot Ads Must Be Accepted
item.subject: Civil Liberties
item.description: The 1st Circuit Court of Appeals has ruled that the Mass. Transit Authority violated free speech rights in refusing to carry advertisements supporting the legalization of marijuana. The Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority rejected three ads submitted by the group Change...

item.title: Dictionary: Top Word of the Year is 'Blog'
item.subject: Blog Related
item.description: The word blog has officially arrived: A four-letter term that came to symbolize the difference between old and new media during this year's presidential campaign tops U.S. dictionary publisher Merriam-Webster's list of the 10 words of the year. Merriam-Webster Inc....

item.title: Civil Rights Groups Urge Full Investigation of Alberto Gonzales
item.subject: Politics - Other
item.description: Based on a series of leaked White House memos, Human Rights First and other civil rights groups have strong reservations about Alberto Gonzales' record on human rights and adherence to established domestic and international law. Human Rights First, has launched...

item.title: Stupid Law of the Week
item.subject: Crime Policy
item.description: by TChris An ordinance in Provo, Utah prohibits pet owners from keeping a cat and dog in the same home....

item.title: Tom Ridge Steps Down
item.subject: Politics - Other
item.description: Tis the Season. Tom Ridge resigns as Chief of Homeland Security. Kwesi Mfume resigns as head of the NAACP. Mr. Mfume's departure is a loss....

item.description: by TChris TalkLeft has reported (here and here and here) that police may be tempted to rely on Tasers, a "non-lethal" weapon, in situations where lesser force would suffice. TalkLeft has also reported (here) that Tasers may not be as...

item.title: Frances Newton: Parole Board Votes for Stay of Execution
item.subject: Death Penalty
item.description: Bump and Update: The Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles voted to recommend a stay. What will Gov. Rick Perry do? ****************** Frances Newton is not going to the texecution chamber Wednesday without a fight. She's been claiming her innocence...

item.title: Soliciting for Death Row Lawyers
item.subject: Death Penalty
item.description: It might be the hardest lawyer's job in the country--soliciting lawyers to represent death row inmates for free. But it's a full time job for the head of the ABA's Death Penalty Representation Project. Robin Maher is a traveling saleswoman...

item.title: Ibogaine: Cure for Addiction?
item.subject: Crime Policy
item.description: The Sunday Los Angeles Times Magazine has a long article, well worth reading, on the hallucingenic drug Ibogaine, being used in clinics from the Caribbean to Canada to Pakistan, and touted as the new wonder drug to relieve addiction to...

item.title: Advocacy Group to Sue Rumsfeld and Others Over Abu Ghraib
item.subject: War in Iraq
item.description: Raw Story reports that the Center for Constitutional Rights, the advocacy group that brought the successful lawsuit in federal court on behalf of the Guantanamo detainees, is ready to strike again. The group will file suit in Germany Tuesday against...

item.title: Ebersol Plane Crash Update: Body of Son Recovered

item.description: Update: Teddy Ebersol did not suffer. He was ejected from his seat and killed instantly. ************** Bump and Update: Local authorities say they are 99% sure they have found the body of 14 year old Edward "Teddy" Ebersol. They are...
